div.p: Y83/6227, unit 1416, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I thought it best, dear Mr Wilson, to send the letter, concerning the £60.9/-
See M to G. Berry, 28 June 1883. before the end of the finance-year, and gave it to my Assistant, as he had to go to your Accountant about the settlement of the £51 for the iron-cases got from the penal department last year, the Treasury having a day or two ago sent back the papers.
See M to J. Grant, 28 June 1883.

Altho' you kindly said, that there was time for some months for sundry additions to the Estimates, I have thought that perhaps, to simplify matters, the £60.9 might be recovered by adding the words "including arrears" after the item of £330 miscellaneous votes of Gov Botanist on the ordinary estimates for the coming year. Perhaps however that can not be done; but then at all events you have my letter, should a favorable opportunity arise to use it.
